Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: Despite reading the bad reports on this place before we stayed, we made a big mistake!! I dont think I have stayed anywhere as bad in my whole life and I have done some amount of travelling. Where to begin?!! Firstly we couldnt check in until 3pm, so we left our bags in there and had arranged to meet a member of staff at 3pm to get checked in etc. We waited in the rain and nobody showed up until 4pm. No apology, no excuse, nothing at all. We then went into the room, it was FILTHY, the bed hadnt been cleaned in ages and there was an awful smell.. We were given the bed sheets etc and did the beds ourselves. No toliet paper, no soap, and we were only given one small handtowl between my partner and I for 4 nights stay. Discracful. There was no reception desk there so we could not get any help from them at all. The room was so dirty and was very noisy (Being literally right beside Oxford Street) The only reason we booked this accomodation was that everywhere else was booked out for new years and it was the cheapest out of them all.. I would recommend anyone ever thinking of staying in this place, not to- its awful, it really is a filthy hotel

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK HERE”
Reviews.Author: Nichola W
Reviews.Content: - Telephone number given online did not work - Nobody available at the hotel when we arrived, despite a scruffy note on the door saying reception would be open - Shoddy, messy, dirty front of hotel (little door) - Rude staff over the phone once contact made, little English spoken - Charged more than the full nights stay even though we had to find another hotel!! We have now contacted Budget Places.com regarding a refund. Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Take along antibacterial wipes and enjoy the location”
Reviews.Author: Uta H
Reviews.Content: Dirty? yes! But at least, no wall-to-wall carpets and, as far as we could tell, clean sheats & no bugs. The location is great and the area safe, so we kind of took the filth with humour. Upon arrival, we had a thorough do-it-yourself cleaning session with the help of antibacterial wipes (cost us 10 minutes and two pounds for 2 packs of wipes). OK, the blackened chewing gum on the floor remained there and I therefore left my socks on most of the time. The shower curtain was indeed moldy, but the water hot. The toilet seemed ok clean, we nevertheless gave it an antibacterial swipe, too. The staff was ok & mostly friendly and since we arrived in the afternoon, we did not have any problem with the check-in. Good and affordable breakfast is served just across the little (car-free) square and Bond street underground at two minutes walking distance. Overall: The Ivanhoe is cheap and a bit strange, but we spent the money we saved on shopping & good food in town. I hope they soon get a grip or sell the place to someone else, because you actually could turn this into a pearl. Although it turned out to be an enjoyable London weekend for us, we will certainly look for another place to sleep the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest hotel we have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: mikenovacane
Reviews.Content: The only decent thing about this rat hole is that it's location is fantastic. 1 block from Oxford Street and all the shopping. Aside from that, AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!!!! We're pretty sure it's never been cleaned in the past 10 years. It was so bad, that when we checked in (after a fight with the 'receptionist' on the phone, because the front door was locked with a scrap piece of paper taped to it saying 'call this number', all of which was never mentioned anywhere on the booking details, and we were forced to go find a phone to use to call) there was dirty towels, full garbages and just general grime all over the room from the previous visitor. The bed had been made up, but we weren't sure if it was fresh sheets, so we didnt even get under the blankets for fear of finding filth, and ended up using towels for blankets. (in addition, we had to go ask for towels and toilet paper because there were neither when we got into the room) The bathroom has mould everywhere and hair all over the floor and walls from previous vistors aswell. Basically, aside from the decent price, this place is absolutely disgusting and we would HIGHLY recommend not setting foot in it.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking”
Reviews.Author: orsantone
Reviews.Content: As I arrived by Ivanhoe Suite Hotel, I was told that my reservation (for which I had already payed) had been cancelled, as rooms were full. They indicated to me another (far away) hotel, to which they regularly send customers. This mechanism seems to be common, as "complice" hotel accepts to pay taxi transfer and charges same fare. Not much choice when London is full and night is coming...

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: DCATA
Reviews.Content: It is an absolute dump. I actually came to find a place for a couple of weeks stay and stopped by to see their suites. I don't even know how to begin to describe how disgusting this place is. Never seen anything this bad and so run down. Restaurant (in no way associated with Ivanhoe except that they share the building) is amazing. To bad they are in such a dumpy building. What an eyesore for St. Christophers place!

Reviews.Title: “Look for another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mayfire
Reviews.Content: We booked first night at Ivanhoe and we are glad we didn't book more. They never clean the place! There were dust all over the room and the fan in the ceiling has not been used for months. There was a 1cm layer of dust on it. Soaps were laying all over to hide some kind of smell. We can not recommend Ivanhoe Suite hotel because we didn't enjoy a second we stayed there. Old squeeky beds, dirty sheets, dirty bathroom. If you only care about location and a low price, this is for you. If you will be able to get a good sleep, clean towels, and a clean room, dont even bother! It's a dump!

Reviews.Title: “worst room iv ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: choonz2
Reviews.Content: after walkin in the hot sun we found the Ivanhoe hotel,only to be told there wasnt a room 4us and we were given the address of the Berkeley hotel a good 30mins away...it was hot n stuffy,with no facilities 4a cup of tea/coffee,not even a glass 4 sum water,there were springs sticking out of the bed..only good thing was the shower! dont go there..

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: manu051
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ivanhoe suite hotel. Entrance was beside a restaurant and hard to find. Room was very basic but for the price I did not expect much. Clean sheets and towels were provided. For the location and price I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Look at WEBSITE its worse than disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ANNOYED08
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, not even student accommodation, but a squalid, dirty building with rooms. Don't part with any money as you won't get it back and I'm sure if you do book you will want to leave faster than a nlink of an eye!! Bed: dirty stained sheets, stained matress, smelly carpet: soiled smelly, drops of blood, paper on floor etc. Never been hoovered! Shower: Did hot step in as too frightened, smally, mouldy, dirty Left asap should be shut down its an insult to london

Reviews.Title: “Mucky and smelly, horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0095
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this kind of website can have and recomend such a mucky hotel. First of all, nobody was waiting for us (though we sent an e-mail saying the arrival time as they requested), after 1 hour and 45 minutes and two calls a woman came to the "hotel" (it's just a building with some rooms) to give us the keys and to have the money, of course they didn't give us any receipt. When we got in we couldn't even breath because of the foot smell. Finally, when we arrived to the room (the building doesn't have lifts), the room was simple but everything was dirty: the floor, the sheets, the furniture, the bathroom, etc. and the toilet was broken so it didn't flush. Furthermore, before we got into the hotel, we found a family that was going out from it, and they told me that they had to buy sheets in M&S, and products to clean the room and particularly the bathroom. If this hotel was in my country I will denounce them into the consumer organization or even to health organization.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: marinajanis
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, near tube station and Bond Street. The room was essential but clean, not too small not too big; the toilette was clean. Only 1 negative point: they dont clean the room and they dont tidy up the bed every day. Altogether it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had booked this place over the internet.It looked ok from the outside when we finally found it.We pressed the buzzer several times and no-one answered untill we actually rang the receptionist from outside.As soon as we walked in,it had an awful stench.It didnt look like a hotel but rather like a messy student bed-sit.We had no choice but to leave even though we had already paid for it via the internet-yes it was that bad!

Reviews.Title: “A hovel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Put simply, this 'hotel' is a hovel. As a single woman travelling on business I was both disturbed & disgusted staying in this accommodation. Unfortunately, I had booked on the internet for a Â£55 room the previous week & I was told by the 'receptionist' (& is intimidating 'family') that I could not withdraw my booking without forfeiting my room cost. I felt both threatened & intimidated staying here & the fact that there was no lock on the inside of my 'bedsit' door did nothing to dispell my worries. I barricaded myself in for a night of sleep (how many London hotels have you done that in?!) & was only too happy to leave in the morning. The room was filthy & the shower, toilet & door handles were all broken. I would strongly suggest that no-one should put themselves in a situation that this establishment provides & hence, please, please, please, DO NOT BOOK INTO THIS 'SUITE'. My only regret is that I did not read reviews such as this before I booked in a week ago.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an absolute mess, my friend and I stayed here one night on the 27th of January 2005 and we thought it was absolutely discusting! It looked like a broffal! there was dirty washing piled up outside our room door...the breakfast was totally gross...i wouldnt eat it if it was the last thing on this earth...i woke up the next morning and had bed bug bites all over my hands and i didnt have them before i stayed there! I have never seen anywhere so discusting in my life! I WOULD ADVISE EVERYONE NEVER EVER STAY HERE!!!!! I was appalled by the condition the bathroom was in...the shower head was all mouldy, the tiles were chiped and coming off the walls...you could have cut yourself to pieces in there! PLEASE DONT EVER GO THERE!! I wouldnt even stay in this hotel if it was my last choice! I would rather sleep on the streets!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a find”
Reviews.Author: jaju
Reviews.Content: About seven years ago, I starting making short trips to London to go antiquing. I would usually stay at the Ivanhoe, and found it basic, but clean, neat and friendly and very inexpensive (around 67 pounds a night, incl tax and cont. breakfast). The people who worked there and managed the place were very pleasant to deal with. The location is terrific, as there are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby, and I didn't have to be frightened to be alone. There was a middle eastern restaurant with great food downstairs that sayed open pretty late, and I liked to go there too. So, Frommers used to be right. It was a find. I was so dissappointed when about three years ago, I brought my family with me to stay there for two nights. The place had been sold to new owners, who have no idea what even "basic" service is. Piles of old laundry were on all of the narrow stair landings. (there is no elevator; imagine navigating your suitcase around these piles) They didn't service the rooms at all while we were there. When we arrived, there was only one towel for all four of us. I had to go searching through their hall closets in search of more towels or clean linens. When we were checking out, the desk guy was very slow because he was engrossed in some LOUD horrid TV show starring a very fowl mouthed, large breasted, drunken, rude American woman -- a TV show he had playing in their very small first floor landing "lobby". I've read the other reviews and can imagine that if the current management kept up the same dismal service we experienced on our last visit to the Ivanhoe, then it is likely that they have let the hotel get run down and even become full of fleas. How sad. Keep shopping; there are lots of other great places to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: victoriahill
Reviews.Content: This hotel only costs around ?70 per night. It is in an excellent location. Considering you can stay in a 4* hotel in the West End and be kept awake all night by Police sirens this accomodation is very quiet as the restaurants close at about midnight and there is no further noise. Admittedly the accomodation is basic but for the price, location and peace it is a very good base to stay in London. I have stayed in many 4 and 5 * hotels and paid a minimum of ?140 per night for a few extra frills but do you really need a health club and an on site restaurant and bar when London has so many to offer? I would not hesitate to recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A hotel listed on your site should be removed immediately! It is the "Ivanhoe Suite Hotel" in London. It is a very unacceptable place. It is located in a closed off area where hundreds of people are eating and drinking and not accessible by taxi so we had to carry our bags through this maze. There was laundry on the landings and the hotel is very dirty and shabby. We refused to stay there and the man sent us to another hotel that they owned. It was a little better because it is in Russle Square. If we were staying there more than 2 nights we would have looked for a more acceptable hotel probably for less than 88 pounds a night which was the price of this fleabag. You have a review from Frommers that says it is a good hotel and has been refurbished which is completely false. I am sending this so other travelers won't make the same mistake we did. Sincerely Mary Jo Walker

Reviews.Title: “Ivanhoe Suite hotel is not the great value as claimed by Frommers”
Reviews.Author: CDJD
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent 3 weeks touring England, Scotland, & Ireland. Our trip started off with 2 nights in London and the trip ended with one night in London. The last hotel we stayed in was recommended by Frommer's as a "great value with an excellent location". Well the location was good (hard to get to though since it was in an area that didn't permit driving) but the hotel was a dump. If you blink you will miss the entrance to this hotel. We rang the buzzer and knocked on the door for 10 minutes before someone let us in. You are immediately escorted up a very narrow flight of stairs to a reception area no bigger than a guest bathroom. After being left there to wait for the manager who took 15 minutes to arrive we were then escorted to our room. The room looked like it was maybe cleaned 2 a week and the bathroom was cramped and getting the shower to work took no less than a miracle. The worst part is that the rooms are located directly above two restaurants that are open late into the evening. Did I mention that the restaurants offer musical talent that plays until midnight? I definitely don't know when the Frommer review was written but I would not recommend this place to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Ivanhoe Suite Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 St. Christopher's Place, London W1U 1LT, England
